channel.title: The Hon. Connie Mack
channel.description: The Hon. Connie Mack U.S. Representative, Florida 14th District (Remarks as Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: Once again, it's morning in America.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: There are new leaders on the horizon ­ Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan ­ America's comeback team.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: Growing up, I had a plaque on my wall that read:
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: "Life's battles don't always go to the fastest or the strongest, sooner or later those who win are those who think they can."
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: We've always been a people with big dreams and limitless potential.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: After all, this is America.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: Our success is built on our values and our principles, but so many of them are under attack. Our commitment to freedom and liberty, and to everything that makes our country great, seems to embarrass the blame-America-first crowd.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: They penalize individual achievement while praising the power of government. But they have not, cannot and will not destroy our spirit.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: We are proud to be Americans. We are proud of our nation, of our heritage and of our success.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: And it is our commitment to the American story. It's our athletes in London who brought home more medals than any other country. It's our best and brightest who landed an extraordinary rover on Mars.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: It's the Nobel Prize winners, scientists, writers and artists, second-to-none, who inspire us all.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: These are the achievements that are brought about by a free society that honors individual effort.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: We owe it to those who have given so much to regain our strength, and remain one of the strongest forces for freedom the world has ever seen. Our allies deserve our unwavering support and our enemies need to know, we stand to defend freedom at all costs.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: America was built on the belief in free enterprise, hard work, passion and faith.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: We have the awesome responsibility to make that dream a reality.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: That dream is not an impossible dream. It's the American dream. It's sure, it's strong and it's steady.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: Mitt Romney's plans to restore America's promise and purpose will be realized and the American dream will once again be available to all her children.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: We are a nation of dreamers ­ Henry Ford, Thomas Edison, Alexander Graham Bell, the Wright brothers. Dreamers like Neil Armstrong who sought new lands and took giant leaps into American exceptionalism. And dreamers like my friend, Kiko Villiaon.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: You know the story of the others; now let me tell you the story of Kiko.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: In 1960, Kiko fled Castro's Cuba. He came to New York. He became a taxi driver. He worked hard and saved his money. He became a citizen. He moved to Florida. He started a business building boats. He raised a family. He put his children through school. He sold his business. Now he worries about what opportunities lie ahead for his children and their children.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: Kiko has lived the American dream, as have so many others. That's what this election is all about ­ making the American dream a reality again.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: It's not about the past. It's not about what was done wrong. It's not about blaming America. It's quite the opposite.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: Tonight we embark on a renewal of the American dream.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: Tonight we honor those who have come before us and done so much. Many even giving their lives.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: And tonight we honor our children and their children to ensure their dreams ­ whether it's playing under the lights, or starting a business, or being a doctor or a nurse, or a soldier or a sailor, or even a president or a vice president ­ dreams can become realities.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: After all, this is America. And it's morning once again.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack

item.title: Thank you, God bless the United States of America.
item.author: The Hon. Connie Mack
